docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 1.--Chicago and Milwaukee have been omitted from the itinerary of the transcontinental tour arranged by the State Department for the King and the Queen of the Belgians.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2.--Following a two-hour consultation late this afternoon with Dr. Francis Xavier Dercum, a Philadelphia neurologist, and three other doctors at the White House, Rear Admiral Cary T. Grayson, the President's physician, announced in a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2.--Following a two-hour consultation late this afternoon with Dr. Francis Xavier Dercum, a Philadelphia neurologist, and three other doctors at the White House, Rear Admiral Cary T. Grayson, the President's physician, announced in a bulletin issued at 10 o'clock tonight that the President was "a very sick man" and that his condition was less favorable.

headline.main: FIVE DOCTORS SEE PRESIDENT; Nerve Specialist From Philadelphia Among Those Grayson Called. FINDS HE NEEDS MIND REST But Collapse Is Denied--President Not Easily Divertedfrom His Big Problems.PATIENT IS KEPT IN BEDWill Not Leave Washington, butCan See No One Outsideof His Family. President Is Very Nervous. Was Merely Precautionary.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6.--Senator Hitchcock of Nebraska, leader of the Democratic forces in the fight on the Peace Treaty in the Upper House, called on Secretary Tumulty at the White House today, talking over the treaty and ascertaining the prospects of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 6.--Senator Hitchcock of Nebraska, leader of the Democratic forces in the fight on the Peace Treaty in the Upper House, called on Secretary Tumulty at the White House today, talking over the treaty and ascertaining the prospects of seeing President Wilson in the near future.
docs.abstract: Hitchcock gives list of 40 who will block ratification if drastic amendments and reservations are adopted

headline.main: HITCHCOCK LISTS 40 TO PREVENT TREATY "KNIFING"; Tells Tumulty of Program for Democrats Unless Wilson Advises Compromise. TO OFFER INTERPRETATIONS If the Republicans Defeat These Then the Treaty Would Be "Suspended in the Air." SHARP DEBATE IN SENATE McCumber Flays Johnson Amendment--Tells of California andMassachusetts Opinion. Might Leave the Treaty "Suspended." 40 TO PREVENT TREATY 'KNIFING' Republicans Firm on Program. McCumber Assails Amendment. Spurns Distrust of Dominions. Lenroot Challenges McCormick. Differ on State Sentiment. Penrose Sees Ratification By Nov. 1.
